definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale

sentences.english: The gravity enables us to live naturally on land.
sentences.chinese: 地心吸力讓我們能在陸地上正常生活。

sentences.english: Because of gravity, long flight would be exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 由於地心吸力，長途飛行會感到筋疲力盡。

sentences.english: Slam dunking a basketball is a fight against gravity.
sentences.chinese: 扣籃是需要與地心吸力對抗。

sentences.english: When there is no gravitation , our feet no longer stay on the ground .
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有地心吸力，我們的腳就不能再站在地面上了。

sentences.english: That's like blaming gravity for the glass you broke.
sentences.chinese: 那好比打破杯子卻怪罪地心吸力。

sentences.english: At that height, the ability of the tree to pump nutrients is overcome by gravity.
sentences.chinese: 在那高度，樹的能力去泵高營養是戰勝地心吸力。

sentences.english: An apple falls by the force of gravitation.

definition: (lit.) to cry from hunger (from Taiwanese 哭枵, Tai-lo pr. [khàu-iau])/(slang) (Tw) to whine/shut the hell up!/fuck!/damn!
variant of 重複|重复[chong2 fu4]
to dive down fast/to swoop down
